trans-unit.source: Authenticate users of your iOS app with Azure Active Directory Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Authenticate users of your iOS app with Azure Active Directory Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: Learn how to log users into your iOS application with the Active Directory Authentication Library.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to log users into your iOS application with the Active Directory Authentication Library.

trans-unit.source: Add Azure Active Directory single sign-on to your iOS app
trans-unit.target: Add Azure Active Directory single sign-on to your iOS app

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using the Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL).
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using the Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL).

trans-unit.source: You can also enable authentication with less configuration by just using the Mobile Apps SDK, as covered in the [Add authentication to your app] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You can also enable authentication with less configuration by just using the Mobile Apps SDK, as covered in the [Add authentication to your app] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Using this topic on ADAL provides a more integrated authentication experience for end users, and ADAL provides richer capabilities for accessing other AAD-protected resources.
trans-unit.target: Using this topic on ADAL provides a more integrated authentication experience for end users, and ADAL provides richer capabilities for accessing other AAD-protected resources.

trans-unit.source: To be able to authenticate users using ADAL, you must register your application with your Azure Active Directory (AAD) tenant.
trans-unit.target: To be able to authenticate users using ADAL, you must register your application with your Azure Active Directory (AAD) tenant.

trans-unit.source: This is done in two steps.
trans-unit.target: This is done in two steps.

trans-unit.source: First, you must register your App Service and expose permissions on it.
trans-unit.target: First, you must register your App Service and expose permissions on it.

trans-unit.source: Second, you must register your iOS app and grant it access to those permissions.
trans-unit.target: Second, you must register your iOS app and grant it access to those permissions.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: XCode 4.5 and iOS 6.0 (or later versions)
trans-unit.target: XCode 4.5 and iOS 6.0 (or later versions)

trans-unit.source: Completion of the [Get started with Mobile Apps] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Completion of the [Get started with Mobile Apps] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Mobile Services SDK
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Mobile Services SDK

trans-unit.source: The [Active Directory Authentication Library for iOS]
trans-unit.target: The [Active Directory Authentication Library for iOS]

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Review your server project configuration (optional)
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Review your server project configuration (optional)

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Register your application with the Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Register your application with the Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Configure the application to require authentication
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Configure the application to require authentication

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Add a reference to the Active Directory Authentication Library
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Add a reference to the Active Directory Authentication Library

trans-unit.source: Download the [Active Directory Authentication Library for iOS].
trans-unit.target: Download the [Active Directory Authentication Library for iOS].

trans-unit.source: In Xcode Navigator, select your project and click File and choose Add Files to....
trans-unit.target: In Xcode Navigator, select your project and click File and choose Add Files to....

trans-unit.source: Navigate to where you downloaded the library and select ADALiOS.xcodeproj.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to where you downloaded the library and select ADALiOS.xcodeproj.

trans-unit.source: Select your project again and open the Build Settings tab.
trans-unit.target: Select your project again and open the Build Settings tab.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Linking section and add -ObjC to Other Linker Flags.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Linking section and add -ObjC to Other Linker Flags.

trans-unit.source: Select the Build Phases tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the Build Phases tab.

trans-unit.source: Under Target Dependencies, add ADALiOS.
trans-unit.target: Under Target Dependencies, add ADALiOS.

trans-unit.source: Under Link Binary With Libraries, add libADALiOS.a.
trans-unit.target: Under Link Binary With Libraries, add libADALiOS.a.

trans-unit.source: You will now be able to reference the Active Directory Authentication Library in your project.
trans-unit.target: You will now be able to reference the Active Directory Authentication Library in your project.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Add authentication code to the client app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Add authentication code to the client app

trans-unit.source: In the QSTodoListViewController, include ADAL with the following:
trans-unit.target: In the QSTodoListViewController, include ADAL with the following:

trans-unit.source: Then add the following method:
trans-unit.target: Then add the following method:

trans-unit.source: In the code for the loginAndGetData method above, replace INSERT-AUTHORITY-HERE with the name of the tenant in which you provisioned your application, the format should be https://login.windows.net/tenant-name.onmicrosoft.com.
trans-unit.target: In the code for the loginAndGetData method above, replace INSERT-AUTHORITY-HERE with the name of the tenant in which you provisioned your application, the format should be https://login.windows.net/tenant-name.onmicrosoft.com.

trans-unit.source: This value can be copied out of the Domain tab in your Azure Active Directory in the [Azure Management Portal].
trans-unit.target: This value can be copied out of the Domain tab in your Azure Active Directory in the [Azure Management Portal].

trans-unit.source: In the code for the loginAndGetData method above, replace INSERT-RESOURCE-URI-HERE with the App ID URI for your Mobile App.
trans-unit.target: In the code for the loginAndGetData method above, replace INSERT-RESOURCE-URI-HERE with the App ID URI for your Mobile App.

trans-unit.source: If you followed the [How to configure your Mobile App with Azure Active Directory] topic your App ID URI should be similar to https://contosogateway.azurewebsites.net/login/aad.
trans-unit.target: If you followed the [How to configure your Mobile App with Azure Active Directory] topic your App ID URI should be similar to https://contosogateway.azurewebsites.net/login/aad.

trans-unit.source: In the code for the loginAndGetData method above, replace INSERT-CLIENT-ID-HERE with the client ID you copied from the native client application.
trans-unit.target: In the code for the loginAndGetData method above, replace INSERT-CLIENT-ID-HERE with the client ID you copied from the native client application.

trans-unit.source: In the code for the loginAndGetData method above, replace INSERT-REDIRECT-URI-HERE with the /login/done endpoint for your App Service Gateway.
trans-unit.target: In the code for the loginAndGetData method above, replace INSERT-REDIRECT-URI-HERE with the /login/done endpoint for your App Service Gateway.

trans-unit.source: This should be similar to https://contosogateway.azurewebsites.net/login/done.
trans-unit.target: This should be similar to https://contosogateway.azurewebsites.net/login/done.

trans-unit.source: In the QSTodoListViewController, modify viewDidLoad by replacing [self refresh] with the following:
trans-unit.target: In the QSTodoListViewController, modify viewDidLoad by replacing [self refresh] with the following:

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Test the client using authentication
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Test the client using authentication

trans-unit.source: From the Product menu, click Run to start the app
trans-unit.target: From the Product menu, click Run to start the app

trans-unit.source: You will receive a prompt to login against your Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: You will receive a prompt to login against your Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: The app authenticates and returns the todo items.
trans-unit.target: The app authenticates and returns the todo items.
